sections.title: Typical workflow
sections.intro: Configure Gmail with the connection fields and run it as part of a BrainBoost pipeline.

cards.title: Connect
cards.text: Provide gmail_address, account_name, description, filter_type, recent_days, folder_name, search_query, max_messages, create_context, context_dir, show_progress, fresh_start, resume_enabled in the connection form.

cards.title: Fetch

cards.title: Consume
cards.text: Use the emitted items in downstream indexing, search, or automation steps.

items.q: What do I need to configure?
items.a: At minimum: gmail_address, account_name, description, filter_type, recent_days, folder_name, search_query, max_messages, create_context, context_dir, show_progress, fresh_start, resume_enabled. Additional fields may be optional depending on your use case.
Writes BrainBoost context artifacts and emits structured items downstream.
Outputs are emitted to downstream subscribers in the BrainBoost pipeline. Some datasources also write artifacts (context files, catalogs, or exports) locally based on your configuration.
